Dear Ms. Hardin:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 05/17/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Settlement Agreement (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is required.
It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
DHHS Policy Required Participation in Development - Foster Parent /
FOM 722-08C Caregiver
Page 2
The individual activities required by the foster
parent/caregiver to meet the specific individual needs of
the child placed in their home are included in the PATP.
The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required
and indicates that the foster parent/caregiver
acknowledges and agrees to the activities required to meet
the needs of the child in their care. Additionally, the PATP
details the services and activities provided by the foster
care worker to assist the foster parent/caregiver in caring
for the child.
In one of three foster care child’s record reviewed, one did not
have documentation that the PATP was reviewed, signed and
dated by foster parent/caregiver or parent.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL 3/25/21
FOM 722-08E Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary.
Completion Requirements:
The caseworker must complete the DHS-69, Foster
Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary, and upload to
MiSACWIS within the timeframe required for the specified
change.
 Within three business days of foster care or juvenile
justice program or case closure.
4

In one of four closed foster child records reviewed, one did not
show documentation of the DHS-69 for the child’s case closure.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
400.12409 Education Policy
The agency was advised to include youth grades in the document session in
MiSACWIS.
400. 12418 Development of service plans
The agency was advised to make sure both foster
parents/caregiver/parents/child 14 plus signed and date the PATP that
accompany the service plans
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency received a special investigation on 01/21/22, SI#2022C0201004,
Corrective Action Plan was received on 03/25/2022. The agency was in violation with
rule 400.12207. The agency admitted the error and has followed their corrective
action plan.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for their renewal inspection dated
03/12/2021. The agency was in violation with rules 400.12212, 400.12311,
400.12312, 400.12418, 400.12419, 400.12607, ISEP 6.49, Policy 722.6E, 722.6B,
722.8, 722.8C, 722.9. The agency has been following their corrective action plan as
they only have one repeat violation for this interim inspection.
VI. DCWL FIELD ANALYST FINDING:
The Analyst found no safety alerts/concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
5

Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Catholic Charities of
Southeast Michigan continue on a regular license.
